intro: Hemitelia lechleri, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and produces a milky sap known as latex. The plant is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its latex has been historically used for producing natural rubber and has various traditional medicinal applications. The tree thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
